title: Black Sesame Shortbread
ingredients: ¼cup (35g) black or white sesame seeds
directions: 1. Preheat oven to 325°F. Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. Cut 10 tablespoons butter into 1-inch pieces and melt in a small saucepan over medium heat. Swirl occasionally until fully melted, about 3 minutes. Set aside to cool.
3. In a medium bowl, whisk together 1½ cups flour, ⅔ cup powdered sugar, and 1½ teaspoons salt.
4. Crush ¼ cup sesame seeds in a resealable plastic bag using a wine bottle or rolling pin (or use a spice grinder/mortar and pestle). Add to dry ingredients and whisk to combine.
5. Whisk ⅓ cup tahini into the cooled melted butter, then stir into dry mixture with a spatula until a rough dough forms. Knead lightly with hands until no dry spots remain.

6. Press dough onto prepared baking sheet into a ½-inch-thick 8×8-inch square. Flatten the top with the bottom of a measuring cup. Prick all over with a fork. Chill for at least 30 minutes or up to overnight (cover if overnight).
7. Cut chilled dough into 16 equal 2-inch squares and space them evenly on the baking sheet.
8. Bake for 30–40 minutes, until lightly golden all over. While warm, sprinkle lightly with granulated sugar. Cool completely before serving.
